Siimee™

February of 2023 to Present

Visit Siimee™

About Siimee

"Siimee is a social impact company committed to reforming the recruiting and hiring process by reducing the biases that often occur."

My Involvement

At Siimee, I filled many roles, including using JavaScript to program a series of essential features such as login and onboarding, as well as a series of chat features. Additionally, I researched existing recruiting and hiring platforms which contributed to UX/UI decisions made during the creation of the app.

Volunteer Work

Code for PDX

April of 2023 to Present

Visit Code for PDX

About Code for PDX

"As a Code for America Brigade, we're part of a national network of civic-minded volunteers who contribute their skills toward using the web as a platform for local government and community service."

My Involvement

At Code for PDX, I was involved in working on their PASS project. Currently still in early development, the PASS application utilizes Solid Data Pods as decentralized data stores to digitally archive documents for housing insecure individuals. Thus far I have finished implementing securely transferring sensitive client data from scanned driver's license PDF417 barcodes into Solid Data Pods, utilizing the JavaScript version of the zxing barcode scanning library.

Dev Stack

Personal Projects

CityStats API

February of 2023 to Present

Visit CityStats APISource Code/Documentation

About CityStats API

"CityStats API returns essential statistics about all 50 American states as well as the top most populous 229 cities in America."

Project Description

I wrote CityStats as a way of easily accessing essential statistics about American cities and states. While the US census has its own API, I found it unintuitive and decided to write my own version. Utilizing python's Beautiful Soup Library, I created a web scraping script. This script alongside GNU's cron command line utility, automatically updates the API's data each election cycle (with some human intervention to ensure accuracy). Using a NodeJS/Express server along with a SQLite database, I hosted this API on the Linode Cloud Platform (now Akamai), with the intention that it be used by the general public and developers.

Dev Stack

brianhayes.dev

May of 2023 to Present

Source Code/Documentation

About This Website

"You're currently visiting my personal portfolio website and blog! Inspired in part by the minimalist style of Scribe, this site is meant to invite you to take a look at some of my humble works and perhaps read one of my blog posts on software and other topics."

Project Description

This blog is actually the third version of this website, which strives to be more readable and minimal than the previous two iterations. The last version of this blog, titled "LeafBytes", can still be found here, preserved for purposes of posterity. The previous version had some nice CSS animations (and a fun CyberPunk theme!). While, the source code features some of my essential skills in VueJS, in the end I had to admit that some of my design choices were not acceptable for a professional site/blog (unreadable small font sizes and distracting backgrounds). It wasn't long before I found myself wanting to get back to basics with this iteration of my blog.

Thusly, this latest version of my website is written in simple HTML, CSS, and a small amount of JavaScript (okay okay, I used PugJS instead of just pure HTML, but you get the idea 😉). It is running via an NGINX server hosted on an Akamai/Linode Cloud instance. All these icons you see can be credited to the awesome designers over at Iconify!

Dev Stack

About Me

Welcome Traveler!

My name is Brian Hayes and you've somehow stumbled across my humble little corner of the web while journeying along! Thanks for taking a look around. I hope you like what you see so far 😗.

My Story

I've worn many hats in my short time on this small beautiful blue ball we call Earth, and I can tell you I've loved every role I've played. I've been a Son, a Student, a Teacher, an Artist, a Clerk, a Concierge, and an Athlete. The most recent hat I've put on has been that of a Programmer! Specifically that of a Full Stack Web Developer 😀!

Inspired by my best friend/mentor, I took up learning the ins and outs of all things computers a little over 2 years ago. In one of my past lives I was a Digital Artist, so learning to code wasn't completely alien to me as I had more than a basic familiarity with computers working with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, I was working as a Night Auditor at a prestigious hotel. The Hotel Industry wasn't doing too well during that time for obvious reasons, so there was a lot of dead periods during my shifts. Thusly I would find myself, in the dead of night, having all my other tasks completed very early. So...I would break out my laptop (installed with an obscure Linux distro), open up my NeoVim text editor (like a boss 😎), and slowly but surely...I taught myself to code (with lots of feedback from my best friend/mentor of course!).

Late in those evenings and early mornings, I would find myself just as engaged as when I was an Art Student... pouring over every detail, endeavoring to find the most natural, but also most efficient line. Computer Programming is probably the most challenging subject I've ever tried to tackle, but... I've worn many hats, engaged in many struggles, and have loved every moment of it all. Computer Programming, and by extension, Web Development, has been, and continues to be, no different.

Where I Am Now

At the time of this writing, I am running around like a chicken with my head cut off 😅! Sometimes I find myself writing a bash script to automate a part of my terminal based workflow. Other times, I'll find myself preoccupied working at my mentor's Startup company, writing up documentation, adding new features, occassionally creating some... (ahem 😳...) quashing some bugs.

I also have signed up at a local Code for America branch, where I volunteer my programming skills as a form of community service. My goals currently are to progress in many aspects of life, but specifically in gaining more knowledge about computers and computer programming, and to build a successful career in it!

I invite you to take a look at my blog, where you will find articles that document my learning journey. Feel free to reach out to me via any of the contact/social media options as well! You can find the links to these located both above and below.

And be well, Traveler...

Be Well!! ☮️
